lines.text: Honest, Sir James... they're dead people from the grave! Vampires is what they are!
Professor Burke is to be our house-guest, Williams. Have rooms prepared for him.
It's unnerving, Mr. Hibbs! The new maid swears to your Uncle that she saw living dead people in the Balfour house!
Burke, I've called you in again because I believe these strange people leasing Balfour's house link up with his death.
We found his note... and his own pistol beside him! That's suicide, isn't it?
Then what can it all mean? Mysterious people! Lights! Weird noises! And come... see this!
Lucille, I am going to reveal to you that your father did not die by suicide!
You can't mean that someone killed my father!
am going to ask you to put yourself in my hands... to do whatever I say... no matter how trying it may be.
I want you to promise to keep this a secret... from everyone.
Mr. Burke, you make me feel that I should trust you... that you are my friend.
What was he saying to you?
I can't tell you! Please don't ask me!
I don't trust him! Why wouldn't he let Uncle send for the police last night?
And now he is getting you under his spell!
Oh, Arthur... he says that someone killed my father!
Watch my eye and think... think hard. You were in this room that night, remember?
Someone was after your nephew! Or maybe... me!
Remember... Lucille... you... are... doing... this... for... your... father.
Aw, stop kicking! We got more for doing this than we'd earn in a month at the theatre!
I - locked her in there -
Oh, sir... it was 'orrible! Miss Lucille was bidding me good-night, - --
Smithson, have you been drinking?
Oh, no, sir! If I 'ave... I 'opes I chokes on the next one!
Burke... look! It is Roger Balfour!
Come, Burke! We're helpless before such creatures as these!
For one who doesn't believe in vampires, you've taken a sudden interest in them!
Perhaps it's for the same reason that you did, Mr. Hibbs!
Be brave, my dear. Follow my instructions tonight.
Young man, I'll take one of your cigars... and have a little talk with you.
I've suspected you for a long time, Hibbs.
Yes? And I've suspected you!
Someone was after your nephew! Or maybe... me!
I want to know where you've been all night, Williams!
I was in bed. The shot awakened me. I put this on and rushed up, sir.
I'm terribly frightened, Sir James! A voice keeps calling to me from the garden!
It sounded exactly like my father calling... 'Lucy, Lucy'!
Now, don't worry, Miss Lucille. If it really is anything... we'll take care of it.
